minimum of 5+ years working on a team as part of a large it organization.minimum of 5+ years leading build/run team members.proficient in sdlc and agile methodology

excellent oral and written communication skills and organizational skills. experience with scripting and automation in servicenow (javascript, unix shell scripting, windows scripting, powershell, perl, python). experience with service graph connectors & various data sources.

experience in web technologies and apis (rest, soap). experience with application portfolio management, information objects & tpm.experience using csdm framework & configuring dynamic ci groups. applies advanced knowledge and understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to manage a wide variety of projects.

excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to generate actionable insights from data. understanding of incident management, change management, configuration management, and release management as it relates to itil.certifications requiredservicenow fundamentalsservicenow discovery fundamentalsservicenow certified implementation specialist – discoveryservicenow certified implementation specialist – service mappingconfiguration management database (cmdb) fundamentalsitilv4 foundationscloud gcp/aws certification preferred. what is expected of you and others at this level?

job summary

the automations and projects engineer is responsible for designing and implementing automated solutions to improve business efficiency and streamline operations. this role focuses on using make.com to develop automated workflows, monday.com to optimize team collaboration, and aws services to build and maintain a secure, scalable digital infrastructure. this position oversees automation and digital transformation projects, working closely with stakeholders to define requirements, set timelines, and ensure successful execution. the role also supports company-wide innovation by identifying new technologies and improving existing workflows to enhance productivity. collaboration is key, as the automations and projects engineer partners with it, finance, operations, and other teams to understand their needs and develop tailored automation solutions. ongoing monitoring and support are essential to ensure optimal performance and continuous improvement of implemented solutions. this role is ideal for a problem-solver who is passionate about automation, technology, and driving efficiency through digital solutions.

key responsibilities
1. automation implementation: design, develop, and implement automated workflows and solutions using make.com to streamline and enhance business processes across departments.
2. project management: oversee and manage various automation and digital transformation projects. coordinate with stakeholders to define project requirements, timelines, and deliverables.
3. digital infrastructure: build and maintain the company’s digital infrastructure using aws services. ensure the reliability, scalability, and security of digital solutions.
4. workflow optimization: utilize monday.com to create and optimize workflows that improve efficiency and collaboration among departments. customize and automate tasks to align with departmental needs.
5. innovation and change: drive initiatives that support the company’s change transformation and innovation objectives. identify and propose new technologies and processes that can benefit the organization.
6. collaboration: work closely with it, finance, operations, and other departments to understand their needs and develop automation solutions that address their specific challenges.
7. monitoring and support: monitor the performance of implemented solutions, provide ongoing support, and make adjustments as necessary to ensure optimal functionality and effectiveness.

preferably graduate of mechanical engineering, mechatronics engineering, electronic communication engineering, electrical engineering and information communication technology(ict), information technology(it)  

preferably with bms programming experience but not required

with working experience in instrument mounting, setup, configuration, and verification, bms programming, services and maintenance.

ability to build and design bms systems to monitor and regulate various building services, including chillers, heat exchangers, hvac, lighting, power metering, etc.

knowledge in different bms brand, such as niagara, johnson controls, etc. is a plus

knowledge of it and graphic design for bms is an advantage.

experience working with multi-disciplinary teams.

excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

strong verbal and written communication skills.

brief summary of the role:
the engineering team leader is the overall accountable in ensuring all installation, maintenance, modification, overhaul and service, and repair of all line equipment are provided with quality service. ensuring proper execution of all planned and corrective maintenance work and productive utilization of technicians, and contractors reporting directly.

key responsibilities:

1. general administration and execution of management policies
• contributes to the creation and implementation of best practice, vision, strategy, policies, processes, and procedures to aid and improve operational performance of manufacturing.
• ensures brand and consumer trust by implementing all quality, food safety, environment, and occupational health and safety standards, in accordance with kore as well as regulatory requirements set by the dole, denr, dti, fda local government units and all other regulatory agencies relevant to its operations.
• ensures achievement of all site performance metrics in terms of quality, safety, productivity, service level and cost and conduct of necessary routine reviews, action planning, and execution to support the over-all business objective of the company.
• interprets trends, provides analyses, and reviews data relevant to plant manufacturing operations. provides processed manufacturing data to other stakeholders in the organization to push for efficiencies and improvements.
• ensure metrics, reports, and process documentation is available.
• partners with stakeholders in programs and initiatives that will enhance customer relationship and attain smooth issues resolution.
• partners and directs stakeholders from other functions in program and initiatives, and day-to-day activities within the general scope of the role.

2. operations
• provide specialist technical support for line equipment maintenance
• under/ over or inappropriate maintenance activities identified.
• maintenance schedules reviewed periodically
• equipment availability, speed and throughput analyzed
• assist to compile and manage the maintenance resource budget
• provide proposals for replacement of equipment and or upgrades for the yearly capex budgets
• manage equipment upgrades and technological changes

3. maintenance execution
• project manage all line equipment & other assigned areas overhauls
• ensuring proper execution of all planned and corrective maintenance work to all line equipment and other areas assigned
• provide input to and manage expenditure for the unit equipment repairs and maintenance budget
• recommendations made to improve maintenance mix
• standard engineering practices, sop’s developed, documented & implemented
• root cause analyses carried out on breakdowns
• oem support/ specialist called in immediately if it is identified that repair cannot be effected without further support.
• report on breakdowns & repairs carried out completed as per work instruction.
• ensure work orders checked for completion, signed off & captured on cmms

4. management system implementation
• leads line hirac and line haccp according to policy
• participates in and conducts plant audits
• ensures that documentation and records keeping are effectively done
• ensures compliance of the whole team with all management system policies

5. people management
• conducts interviews and selects, the most suitable candidate for vacant positions in his team.
• provides regular coaching and mentoring to assigned associates to ensure that expectations from the role are constantly met.
• conducts regular performance reviews to manage team performance and to set a clear career plan of his/her direct reports.
• identifies training gaps of each member of the team and facilitates the execution of the training plans to ensure that a career development plan for each associate is provided.
• develop and implement effective feedback and recognition system for his direct reports.
• reviews and approves the attendance of the team, including leaves, shifting and overtime, to ensure continuous operations and compliance with cost directions, budget and company policies and procedures.
• implements company rules and regulations among his direct reports and performs consequence management or impose disciplinary measures in cases of violations.
• spearheads people development forum/ succession planning for his team with the rest of the leadership team and ensures progress on the identified development areas for each of his subordinates.
• works with the rest of the management team in laying-down and executing programs in his area of assignment.
• review contracts of service provider and provides people team opportunities areas.
• responsible in promoting industrial peace and cultivating engaged labor unions; ensures they are aligned with company directions.
• actively participates in the collective bargaining agreement negotiations. leads closure of grievance cases and lmc issues and concerns.

6. continuous improvement
• performs regular loss analysis for the assigned line as input for the strategic plans for the line
• develops and ensures implementation of corrective actions plans (cap) for missed kpis and non-compliance
• conducts regular line performance reviews to identify action steps to ensure consistently good kpi results
• manages special projects that will be assigned to the team

key responsibilities

develop and maintain automated test scripts using tricentis tosca.

collaborate with qa, development, and business teams to ensure complete test coverage.

integrate automated tests into ci/cd pipelines using tools such as azure devops, gitlab, and jenkins.

track and report test results, defects, and quality metrics using tools like azure devops, jira, and qtest.

mentor junior testers and support onboarding in automation practices.

continuously update skills in tosca’s latest features including ai-driven testing capabilities.

success metrics

high defect detection and low defect leakage rates.

increased test coverage and reduced manual testing time.

successful ci/cd integration with minimal disruption.

contributions to internal automation knowledge-sharing and team development.

qualifications

experience:

5+ years in software testing, 2+ years in test automation.

2+ years hands-on with tricentis tosca.

experience with agile/scrum and ci/cd workflows.

tools:tricentis tosca, azure devops, gitlab, jenkins, opentext alm, xray, qtest.

certifications:

required: tricentis tosca certification (automation specialist level 1 & 2).

preferred: istqb foundation or advanced level.

able to understand the flat bom vs multi-level bom and break it into modular assemblies and stack-up assemblies.

collaborate with de (design engineer) to understand the make/buy decision and fine tune based on the stand-alone assemblies leading to buy or make decisions.

initiate and support design for excellence and manufacturing process improvement / standardization.

engage with respective site ie to optimize layout and to review the labor hours in case if any doubt arises especially if it is a new type of build never done before.

liaise and coordinate with design engineering, accounts operations, account executives, supply chain, quote team wheneve necessary and have doubts.

liaise and coordinate with test engineering department on testing development or testing issue to estimate test hours.

liaise with customer for all bom / drawing / design issue by generating problem report / supplier problem sheet / supplier request deviation that affects the labor hours estimation.

minimum cad knowledge to analyst 3d drawing from customer.

understanding of routing and labor hours in sap and mes systems.

other duties

erp/mes system software

excellent computer skills in microsoft suite, emphasis in excel.

prior experience in manufacturing of assemblies and test is a must

good interpersonal skills; ability to work alone or in team environment.

diploma in mechanical / electrical / electronics / mechatronics / industrial systems engineering with minimum 5 years working experience in related field can apply.

experience requirement:

exposure to semiconductor industry preferred.

experience on setting up lean line will be a plus

know and able to explore full bom structure (more than 1,000 line) is needed.

self-motivated and resourceful

possesses drive with “can-do” attitude

capable of developing positive work relationship, a favourable work environment within the team and other functional group

job description
-candidate must possess at least vocational diploma/short course -certificate, bachelor's/college degree in engineering (computer/telecommunication), engineering (electrical/electronic), -engineering (mechanical), engineering (mechatronic/electromechanical) or equivalent.

-providing technical training of costumer specific application of various application engineering products in developing stage to the branch personnel for adequate management of the same

we are seeking a proactive and organized technical coordinator to join our dynamic team. this role serves as the central point of communication between clients, service engineers, and internal operations. the technical coordinator is responsible for in office client communication, maintaining inventory of machine parts, and ensuring smooth coordination of technical support activities. if you have strong communication skills, a technical mindset, and a passion for operational efficiency, we'd love to hear from you.

educational background:

graduate of any of the following:

bachelor’s degree in information technology (bsit),

computer science (bscs),

mechatronics engineering (bsmee),

business administration major in operations management (bsba), or

office administration (bsoa).

work experience:

preferably with 1–2 years of experience in a service coordination, technical support, or operations role (fresh graduates may be considered if highly trainable).

skills:

it’s a desk job

- detail- oriented (encoding and documentation)

- good communication skills (coordinates w clients and service engineers)

- strong time management and scheduling abilities (prioritizing job orders and work load)

- able to work under pressure (multitask during urgent breakdown calls)

- proficiency in ms office / google workspace.

key responsibilities:

receive and log client service calls about machine breakdowns.

ask preliminary questions to understand the issue.

coordinate the schedule and dispatch of service engineers.

maintain physical inventory of spare parts, ensure availability, and reorder when stock is low.

communicate status updates between clients and service engineers.

prepare basic reports on service activities and inventory levels.

the technology development department comprises of diverse groups of curious, world class engineering specialists. we are experts in our fields, and we ensure dyson products are on the edge of what’s possible. the department encompasses specialist groups across different disciplines – product performance, acoustics, fluid dynamics, structural dynamics, materials. this role resides within the product performance group, which provides the technical analysis of hair appliance product performance. such quantifying and optimising how well the product dries and styles hair.

about the role


identify key factors affecting performance and use basic analysis tools (e.g., excel, scripts, minitab) to support optimization and predictive tasks.

assist in designing and carrying out tests to evaluate performance, ensuring results are clearly analyzed and recommendations are suggested under guidance.

help define problem statements, highlight risks, and provide supporting analysis for performance improvement, always considering customer needs and business goals.

proactively develop technical skills through project involvement, self-learning, and training, aiming for growth in product performance understanding.

collaborate effectively within project teams, communicate findings clearly to stakeholders, and help maintain organized and accessible documentation.

contribute ideas for process improvements, support new methods or tools, and participate in activities that enhance product performance and reliability.

about you


bachelor’s degree in mechanical or mechatronics engineering (or equivalent).

ideally 4+ years’ experience in product design/development; less may be considered for strong candidates.

solid grasp of engineering fundamentals, measurement, and statistical analysis.

proficiency with data processing tools (minitab, matlab, excel); some experience with cad/cae tools preferred.

experience with statistical modeling (e.g., multiple regression) is advantageous.

strong written and verbal communication skills; able to tailor communication and influence within project teams.

able to work independently on the more varied and complex tasks and/or demonstrate functional leadership without direct supervision as needed.

dyson philippines monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and bonuses. beyond that, you’ll enjoy a transport allowance and comprehensive medical care and insurance. but financial benefits are just the start of a dyson career. professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. and with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fueling and realising ambition.

job description - warehouse process engineer (00984e)

warehouse process engineer - 00984e

great people make schneider electric a great company.

do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose and that continuously creates an inclusive environment where you are empowered to do your best and be innovative? start making an impact!

the role: warehouse process engineer

overview: expert specialized in a specific high-tech area of knowledge for industrialization/manufacturing (lean manufacturing, mtm, ergonomics, line design, mph, simulation tools, cost analysis, value stream, etc.)

ensure the right process in terms of capacity & utilization, quality & cost of warehouse and equipment, to ensure the right delivery and more productivity from the factory, while cross-coaching to improve the knowledge, skill, capabilities, and efficiency of team members.

involve activity of rnd contribution: designing new process to meet economic and technical demand. design and construct trial production lines. conduct product processing activities based on self-developed technology.

what will you do?

· driving performance.

· to lead and deploy all warehouse processes in compliance with lean and sps

· to drive continuous process improvement and cost reduction program

· develop, motivate, and challenge people to achieve the target

· implementing the sps system.

· global architecture for warehouse

· waterspider loop design and optimization

· organization for evacuation of finished goods and waste

· ensure reliability of warehousing time definition

· ensure safety & ergonomics conditions in warehouse and material handling activities

· define and involve the information system in line with the principles set out in mph & warehouse

· achieve the targeted sps score and maintain it for the year through continuous improvement tools and techniques and be involved in standardization deployment with benchmarking and knowledge sharing.

· adapt continuous improvement approach to the mph and warehouse to optimize safety, quality, lead time & cost

· execute me functions according to the business objectives and policies & procedures. continuously improve the efficiency, accuracy, and effectiveness of the functions. drive down overall cost of manufacturing including cycle rates, head counts, administration expenses, material scrap

who would be successful?

· graduated from technical university, or technology and education university (major: industrial engineering, industrial system engineering, mechanical engineering, mechatronics)

· at least 5-6 years of practical experience in the advanced manufacturing field. minimum 5 years experience on a similar position

· required skills & knowledge for the position:

· strong management and coordination skills

· technical skill

· proven track record in driving corrective actions and implementing change

· excellent communication skills with high potential in lean, 6 sigma, leadership, and process development are required

· extensive knowledge of industrial engineering philosophies and processes

· strong communication skills, decisive, organized, good analyst, passionate.

· team player, good relationship with regional team and engineers.

· fluent in oral and written english.

· entrepreneurial spirit, clearly results-oriented, flexible and proactive

· clear identification with company goals, high initiative and positive thinking

· to ensure that safety training for subordinates

· working arrangements: 6x a week, full-time onsite

what’s in it for me?

· global family leave

· comprehensive medical coverage for employee and dependents

· worldwide employee stock ownership

· flexible work arrangement

…and more!

who will you report to? methods engineering manager


why us?

schneider electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. we strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

you must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. this position will be posted until filled.

it is the policy of schneider electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

summary:

to support our rapid business expansion, we are creating a high-impact position focused on embedding service readiness into the new product development and introduction (npdi) process across our power and thermal product portfolios — including ups, sts, batteries, switchgear, busway, crac units, chillers, and liquid cooling systems.

this role is ideal for a hands-on engineer who can proactively identify service gaps, drive cross-functional coordination, and build repeatable, scalable processes that ensure all products are launch-ready from a service perspective. you will play a key role in closing the loop between engineering and service — improving maintainability, documentation, spare parts planning, and long-term field support for mission-critical infrastructure.

responsibilities

engage with r&d teams during early development stages to identify serviceability risks and influence design for maintainability.

review and validate design features from a service perspective (e.g., accessibility, modularity, fault isolation).

ensure delivery of all service-related documentation and materials (e.g., service manuals, exploded views, tool lists, training packages) prior to launch.

collaborate with logistics, spare parts, and technical support teams to ensure full support readiness on day 1.

maintain and enforce a service readiness checklist as a mandatory npdi gate.

lead or support field trials, pilot deployments, and feedback integration for design refinement before mass rollout.

participate in or lead fmea and reliability engineering reviews focused on serviceability and field failure prevention.

define internal service readiness best practices and standard workflows for future npdi programs.

qualifications

bachelor's degree in mechanical, electrical, or mechatronics engineering (or related discipline).

minimum 3 years' experience in product development, field service, or technical support — ideally in power systems (e.g., ups, batteries, switchgear) and/or hvac/thermal systems (e.g., crac, chillers, liquid cooling).

strong understanding of the npdi/npi process from a serviceability and lifecycle support standpoint.

proven ability to work across global teams including engineering, service, logistics, and technical documentation.

experience with bom structuring, service documentation, and tools like solidworks, autocad, windchill, or sap.

preferred skills

familiarity with ups and sts/ats topologies, battery chemistries (li-ion, vrla), and bms architecture.

experience with crac units, chillers, direct-to-chip and liquid cooling technologies.

exposure to service software tools, remote diagnostics, firmware upgrade processes, and hmi/scada interfaces.

understanding of applicable compliance standards (e.g., iec 62040, as/nzs 3000, ul, nfpa 70e) for electrical and thermal equipment.

🏢 about signify

through bold discovery and cutting-edge innovation, we lead an industry that is vital for the future of our planet: lighting. through our leadership in connected lighting and the internet of things, we're breaking new ground in data analytics, ai, and smart solutions for homes, offices, cities, and beyond.

at signify, you can shape tomorrow by building on our incredible 125+ year legacy while working toward even bolder sustainability goals. our culture of continuous learning, creativity, and commitment to diversity and inclusion empowers you to grow your skills and career.

join us, and together, we’ll transform our industry, making a lasting difference for brighter lives and a better world. you light the way.

more about the possibilities:

are you a tech-savvy and innovative student or graduate with a passion for engineering? we are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated individual to join our team in engineering departments (process, r&d, production, maintenance or other). in this role, you will use your 🔬analytical skills and 💡creative mind to solve complex problems and ensure that our systems meet industry standards and regulations. you will be responsible for 📈improving and 🛠️optimizing existing systems, ensuring they meet industry standards and regulations.

📋 responsibilities that might be yours (depends on the department and area):

designing and optimizing manufacturing processes to maximize efficiency, quality, and safety.
developing and implementing process control plans to ensure consistency and reliability.
active participation in risk management of product and processes
troubleshooting and technical support for production crew and associated departments
cooperate daily with engineering project manager, r&d team, supply chain, engineering and quality to have new products on the market with high quality and high logistics performance.
contributing to the development of new products by providing input on the manufacturability and scalability of proposed designs.
developing prototypes and conducting testing to evaluate the feasibility and performance of new product concepts.
analyzing market trends and customer needs to identify opportunities for new product development.

📚 requirements:

higher technical background (electronics, mechatronics, electrical, mechanics or related)
good communication skills
ability of solving problems
communicative english - spoken and written and advanced or native polish.

everything we’ll do for you

we’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. learning is fundamental to our culture. through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. you have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.

you can grow a lasting career here. we’ll encourage you, support you, and challenge you. we’ll help you learn and progress in a way that’s right for you, with coaching and mentoring along the way. we’ll listen to you too, because we see and value every one of our 30,000+ people.

knowledge of ate (automated test equipment), robotics, or instrumentation is an advantage.
strong problem-solving, communication, and multitasking skills.
familiarity with ticketing systems, crm tools, or remote diagnostic platforms.
willingness to work in shifting schedules or coordinate with global support teams as needed.

the company nurse is responsible for providing basic healthcare services to employees, promoting occupational health and safety practices, and ensuring compliance with health regulations in a food manufacturing environment.

1. medical care & first aid

provide first aid and emergency care to injured or ill employees on-site.

monitor and manage the clinic’s medical supplies and equipment.

maintain accurate medical records and incident reports.

2. health monitoring & wellness

conduct regular health assessments (e.g., blood pressure, weight, temperature).

implement health and wellness programs (vaccinations, seminars, etc.).

support annual physical examinations and medical screenings.

3. occupational health & safety

conduct routine workplace inspections for health-related hazards.

participate in safety drills, trainings, and incident investigations.

4. compliance & reporting

ensure compliance with dole, doh, and other regulatory bodies.

prepare and submit required medical and accident reports.

maintain confidentiality of employee medical records.

coordinate with external health service providers and hmo partners.

assists with hmo enrollment, deletions, and coordination with providers

responds to employee inquiries regarding health benefits.

provide health education and counseling to employees.

assist hr in return-to-work assessments and health clearances.

participates in hr-driven wellness and employee engagement activities.

licensed registered nurse (rn)

preferably with bosh (basic occupational safety and health) training for nurses

at least 1 -2 years of clinical or occupational health experience in a manufacturing or food industry

good communication and interpersonal skills

proficient in microsoft office and report preparation

knowledge of dole and doh health compliance standards

ability to work independently and handle emergencies

proven experience managing a technical team and implementing engineering projects.

Role of Job: Winding Specialist - Electromechanical Assembly & Equipment Support
Description:
job summary:


we are seeking a detail-oriented and technically skilled winding specialist to perform precision coil winding and assembly for electromechanical equipment used in field operations, sensors, or energy-related applications. this role is essential in the maintenance, repair, and fabrication of components that require exact winding specifications and quality assurance.

the ideal candidate has hands-on experience working with winding machines, motor/generator components, or custom coils, and is familiar with industrial safety standards and workshop procedures.

key responsibilities:

perform coil winding for motors, transformers, or specialized sensor components according to technical specifications and standards.
assemble, install, or repair wound components for operational or field-use equipment.
operate manual or semi-automated winding machines with a high level of accuracy and care.
read technical drawings, blueprints, or work instructions to ensure correct winding configurations.
conduct visual and mechanical inspections of finished components to ensure product quality.
assist in preventive maintenance and troubleshooting of equipment related to winding operations.
maintain workshop cleanliness and follow safety protocols in handling materials and tools.
record production output, materials used, and defects for quality tracking and continuous improvement.
qualifications:

vocational diploma or associate degree in electrical technology, electromechanical, mechatronics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in coil winding, motor repair, or electromechanical assembly.
familiarity with winding machines, tools, and materials such as wire gauges, insulation, and resins.
ability to interpret technical drawings and wiring diagrams.
strong attention to detail and manual dexterity.
good understanding of safety procedures in a manufacturing or technical environment.

great people make schneider electric a great company.

do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose and that continuously creates an inclusive environment where you are empowered to do your best and be innovative?

the role: tender engineer

what will you do?

· review customer requirements and request for quotes (rfq)

· preparation of professional quotations in a timely manner from schematic diagrams and customer specifications.

job title
industrial engineer job description
about signify


through bold discovery and cutting-edge innovation, we lead an industry that is vital for the future of our planet: lighting. through our leadership in connected lighting and the internet of things, we're breaking new ground in data analytics, ai, and smart solutions for homes, offices, cities, and beyond.

at signify, you can shape tomorrow by building on our incredible 125+ year legacy while working toward even bolder sustainability goals. our culture of continuous learning, creativity, and commitment to diversity and inclusion empowers you to grow your skills and career.

join us, and together, we’ll transform our industry, making a lasting difference for brighter lives and a better world. you light the way.

more about the role


this is an exciting job opportunity for you to light the way as a industrial engineer in professional pila factory @ signify.

do you want to make a real impact on the future of the lighting industry? join signify – the global leader in sustainable and smart lighting solutions. as an industrial engineer specializing in automation and digitalization, you will be a key player in transforming our factories where cutting-edge technology meets innovation.

why is this role unique?

collaborate with expert teams across multiple countries, sharing knowledge and developing innovative solutions together.

your ideas and actions will influence millions of lighting products delivered to customers worldwide.

gain access to the latest technologies in automation, robotics, and iot applied in our smart factories.

enjoy real growth opportunities in a dynamic, supportive culture that values creativity and initiative

what challenges await you?

designing and implementing industrial automation systems and digitalization solutions for production processes.

analyzing and build implementation production lines according to industry 4.0

coordinating activities between production, it departments, and technology suppliers.

monitoring the effectiveness of implemented solutions and continuously improving processes.

industry project management

investigating methods to improve manufacturing efficiency

knowledge about modern manufacturing technologies.

more about you


while we value and appreciate all applicants, we believe that the following experience and skills will be needed to shine brightly in this job opening:

what do we expect from you?

are you ready to take your career to the next level? we're looking for talented individuals with the following qualifications:

 educational background: a technical degree in fields such as automation, mechatronics, industrial engineering, or related areas.

professional experience: hands-on experience in industrial automation, digitalization, or control systems.

if you have a passion for innovation and a drive to excel, we would love to hear from you! join us and be a part of a team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous improvement.

technical skills: familiarity with industry 4.0 tools, robotics, and plc programming.

design expertise: experience in mechanical design and proficiency with cad tools, preferably solid edge.

problem-solving abilities: strong skills in problem-solving, task prioritization, and thriving in a dynamic work environment.

project management: proven project management skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with others.

language proficiency: excellent communication skills in both english and polish. 

everything we’ll do for you and offer you

competitive salary and bonus 💰💡

multisport card and private medical care 🧑‍🤝‍🧑🥽

career growth and professional development opportunities💹

working in multinational and diverse working culture in the company with strong sustainability values 🌍 💚

lot of fun in participating in our well-being and team building activities

extra occasional funds and benefits (christmas, kid’s day, other) 🎄👶

discount for signify and philips products 😋

learning opportunities: e-learning platform with a wide portfolio of courses and tutorials, mentoring programs 📚🔖📑

you can grow a lasting career here. we’ll encourage you, support you, and challenge you. we’ll help you learn and progress in a way that’s right for you, with coaching and mentoring along the way. we’ll listen to you too, because we see and value every one of our 30,000+ people.

we believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace fosters creativity, innovation, and a full spectrum of bright ideas. with a global workforce representing 99 nationalities, we are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment where every voice is heard and valued, helping us all achieve more together.

come join us, and together we can light the way.

Role of Job: Call Center Technical Support Bilingual: Nihongo(GCS,Philippines:Cebu)
Description:
our purpose  

teradyne, where experience meets innovation and drives excellence in every connection. we are fueled by creativity and diversity of thought, and in our workforce. our employees are supported to innovate and learn something new every day.  we cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. we believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation, and delivers better business results.  

opportunity overview 

the technical support representative is the primary interface for our universal robots (ur) & mobile industrial robots (mir) customers' hardware and software technical assistance. they are responsible for synthesizing both internal and external feedback and turning it into actionable items, working with the corrective actions, supporting teams and projects that will deliver solutions and address issues for the customers.  works with the partner organizations and other technical groups to ensure customer satisfaction on key accounts. 

business hours: monday - sunday 24x7work hours: 5 scheduled days, which may include weekends, holidays, and on-call

communicate effectively with customers to understand and resolve their technical problems, through phone, email, or case tickets via an incident-tracking system or crm (customer relationship management) tool.
provide tier 1 technical assistance to troubleshoot and diagnose hardware and software issues.
manage multiple cases efficiently following the service-level agreement (sla) and maintain detailed procedural documentation.
resolve customer and field-reported faults, queries, and complaints as the first point of contact, using the tools and systems provided.
adheres to the incident reporting and escalation system and procedures.
contributes to meeting the team goals, metrics, and key performance indicators.

all about you we seek individuals who share our passion and determination. our commitment to customer success drives us to go the extra mile. if you’re ready to join us on this mission, take a closer look at the minimum criteria for the position. 

fluent in english and nihongo languages.
professional phone, verbal, and written communication skills.
knowledgeable with the microsoft office package (excel, word).
basic knowledge of web technology, email, and the internet.
keen on details.
demonstrate excellent workload management skills.
flexibility with supporting “on-call” after-hours support and shifting schedules based on customer demand and/or group manpower shortages.
bachelor’s degree, preferably in a technical or engineering field (mechanical engineering, electronics & communications engineering, mechatronics, or related)
minimum of 1 year of technical experience.  related experience in a customer support role is a plus.
we are only considering candidates local to the position location and are unable to provide relocation for this position. this position is not eligible for philippine work visa sponsorship.

we are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. we will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Company Name: Al Hazm Est for Industrial Materials/ Al Hazm Industrial Equipments
Description:
service mechanical engineer – machine tools

the machine tools mechanical service engineer is responsible for the installation, maintenance, and repair of mechanical systems and components in machine tools.

minimum qualification:

bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, mechatronics, or a related field.
relevant certifications in machine tool maintenance and repair are a plus.
?minimum experience:
minimum of 3-5 years of experience in mechanical service engineering, specifically with machine tools.
proven track record of diagnosing and repairing complex mechanical systems.
other requirement
strong mechanical and technical aptitude.
proficiency in reading and interpreting mechanical drawings and schematics.
excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
effective communication and interpersonal skills.
ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

responsibilities**
 
installation and commissioning:
install and commission new machine tools and related equipment.
ensure all mechanical systems are correctly assembled and aligned.
perform initial testing and adjustments to achieve optimal performance.
maintenance and repair
conduct regular preventive maintenance on machine tools to minimize downtime.
diagnose and troubleshoot mechanical issues in machine tools and systems.
repair or replace defective components, such as bearings, gears, and other mechanical parts.
technical support:
provide technical support and guidance to customers and operators.
train customers on the proper use and maintenance of machine tools.
respond to emergency service calls and provide timely solutions to mechanical problems.
documentation and reporting:
maintain detailed records of maintenance and repair activities.
prepare service reports and documentation for each job performed.
report any recurring issues or potential improvements to management.
 
 
 
safety and compliance:
adhere to all safety protocols and regulations while performing duties.
ensure compliance with company policies and industry standards.
identify and address potential safety hazards in the work environment.
continuous improvement:
stay updated with the latest advancements in machine tool technology.
participate in training and development programs to enhance technical skills.
contribute to the improvement of service procedures and practices

company description


at western digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible.

at our core, western digital is a company of problem solvers. people achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. for decades, we’ve been doing just that—our technology helped people put a man on the moon and capture the first-ever picture of a black hole.

we are seeking a highly experienced senior development engineer to join our growing team. this is a dynamic and multifaceted role involving high-technology product design and development across various industries. as a small, collaborative team, we value engineers who are proactive, versatile, and capable of driving projects from concept to production with minimal oversight. 

the ideal candidate will bring deep expertise across electronic, embedded, and mechanical design, along with a hands-on, solutions-driven approach. there is a long-term opportunity for the right person to become a core member of the business and participate in company ownership in future. 

responsibilities: 

lead end-to-end product development from concept design to production release 

design and develop electronic schematics and multilayer pcbs using altium designer 

develop embedded firmware and code for microcontroller-based systems 

design and implement fpga logic using vhdl 

ensure mechanical and pcb integration, working with solidedge and other cad tools 

develop and manage production test documentation and technical development records 

ensure compliance with electromagnetic emissions standards and design for regulatory compliance 

collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to meet technical, quality, and delivery objectives 

contribute to problem-solving, innovation, and improvement initiatives across varied project domains 

adapt to diverse sector requirements, leveraging broad technical exposure 

requirements: 

minimum 10 years of industry experience in electronic and embedded systems development 

strong proficiency with altium designer for schematic and pcb layout 

solid experience with vhdl for fpga development 

competence in embedded firmware development, including c/c++ 

proficiency in mechanical design principles and integration using tools such as solidedge 

proven track record of managing multidisciplinary product development projects 

familiarity with compliance standards including emi/emc requirements 

exceptional documentation and version control practices 

ability to work independently and collaboratively in a small, fast-paced team environment 

strong communication skills and the ability to explain technical concepts clearly 

desirable: 

experience working across multiple industry sectors and technologies 

exposure to low-volume, high-complexity product development environments 

understanding of production test procedures and design-for-manufacture (dfm) principles 

interest in long-term business growth, leadership, or equity participation opportunities 

software proficiency: 

altium designer 

solidedge or equivalent cad software 

vhdl development environments 

embedded c/c++ compilers and toolchains 

ms office suite and documentation tools 

education: 

bachelor's degree in electronics engineering, mechatronics, or a related discipline (required) 

postgraduate qualifications or relevant certifications (advantageous) 

personal attributes: 

independent and self-directed – able to take initiative and own projects end-to-end 

versatile – comfortable switching between electronics, firmware, and mechanical integration 

detail-oriented – thorough in design, documentation, and testing 

collaborative – enjoys working closely with a small team to solve complex problems 

growth-minded – open to future leadership or ownership opportunities within the company

applicant location: must be filipinos living in the philippines

are you looking to grow your career in manufacturing processing at one of the leading semiconductor companies in the world? put your knowledge and background to work at texas instruments (ti) as our engineer! 

roles may include:

equipment engineering: maintains, enhances, and installs advanced semiconductor manufacturing equipment.
process engineering: drives process improvements, data analysis and gaining a deeper knowledge of a specific process.
product engineering: resolves application issues designing, debugging, and correlating test hardware and software.
facilities engineering: supports and evaluates operational and site conditions at a ti facility.
quality engineering: analyzes control data and conformance of manufactured units .
packaging engineering: develops internal and external solutions for semiconductor packaging technologies
manufacturing supervisor: supervises the operators and implements activities to meet production goals, quality and objectives.
production planning: develops detailed production schedules based on planned orders, forecasts, and inventory levels while closely working with manufacturing teams to ensure necessary resources and materials are available to meet production goals.

about texas instruments

texas instruments incorporated (nasdaq: txn) is a global semiconductor company that designs, manufactures and sells analog and embedded processing chips for markets such as industrial, automotive, personal electronics, communications equipment and enterprise systems. at our core, we have a passion to create a better world by making electronics more affordable through semiconductors. this passion is alive today as each generation of innovation builds upon the last to make our technology more reliable, more affordable and lower power, making it possible for semiconductors to go into electronics everywhere. learn more at ti.com.

texas instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment.

preferred qualifications:

demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills
strong verbal and written communication skills
ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions
strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery

1.0 general job description

the csa shall be mainly responsible for:

1. generating revenue from parts/service sales according to the objectives of the sasd customer support section

2. customer relations management, providing after-sales, commercial, and technical support to assigned accounts

2.0 duties and responsibilities

the csa shall:

2.1 manage the after-sales activities for the accounts/territories to be assigned, through

a. periodic visit to customer to pro-actively assess their after-sales requirements

b. aligning the customer’s after-sales requirements with the products and services of eos, and

c. promoting the usage and selling of eos’ parts and services to generate parts and service revenue.

2.2 recover inactive customers to generate parts and service revenue.

2.3 develop and manage new accounts/territories to generate revenue from the sales of parts and services for core and non-core products.

2.4 manage the customer relationship activities to maintain customer retention, by:

a. monitoring the status of customer’s equipment to ensure that appropriate service support is provided at all times

b. ensuring that customers’ requests for assistance/complaints are given appropriate and on-time response and action

c. tracking the progress of service job and parts order, updating the customers regularly on the status and ensuring that these are completed or delivered within the committed time,

d. promoting goodwill and building good business relationship

2.5 regularly coordinate with the service team to:

a. ensure that the appropriate service support is provided to customers at all times

b. technical reports/equipment inspection reports are timely submitted to customers and available on-time for preparation of parts/service proposals

c. track the progress of service job orders, address operational issues/concerns, and ensure that they are completed within the committed time

d. visit machine jobsites (as may be necessary), to fully assess the condition of the equipment and determine the required parts/services

2.6 manage the parts and service sales process, through:

a. submission of monthly after-sales revenue forecast

b. submission of reports

b1. weekly activity plan

b2. weekly revenue results

b3. weekly quotation tracking

b4. monthly parts and service revenue with analytics

b5. other reports that may be needed as the job may require

c. preparation and submission of parts/service proposal

d. follow-through with customers for the approval of parts/service proposals

e. collection of payment for parts/service sales transactions

f. coordination with parts department/supply chain departments to ensure timely delivery of customers’ parts order

2.7 regularly coordinate with the cs team leader/parts manager for parts stock planning to ensure the availability of parts for the after-sales business.

2.8 assist in marketing activities relative to parts and service promotions.

2.9 execute other functions related to her/his foregoing duties and responsibilities, as may be required/assigned by her/his superiors.

qualifications:

- preferably a graduate of mechanical engineering or technical vocational course in heavy equipment, automotive or mechatronics

- with minimum 1-2 years relevant work experience in the heavy equipment or light equipment, or automotive industry, in the field of customer relations/ parts and service sales

- technologically-adept and familiar with computers and office applications

- detail-oriented, can read and understand equipment manuals and be able to correctly identify parts requirements and corresponding part numbers

- excellent interpersonal relationship and can interact well with customers and teammates

universal robina corporation is looking for a production operator.

the production operator operates specific machine/s assigned to him following standard operating procedures and ensures that they are in good running condition. responsible for producing goods within standard specifications at the right time at a minimum cost. performs immediate corrective maintenance and troubleshooting in case machine breaks down and conducts preventive maintenance as planned until authorized personnel are available.

what are the roles and responsibilities?

prepares and checks quality of all the materials needed for the scheduled operations.

cleans, sanitizes and prepares the machine/s and surrounding area before operations in accordance with standard cleaning and start-up procedures.

checks if machine/s are in good running condition.

ensure less start up rejections

operates the machine/s in accordance with the standard operating procedures.

follows good manufacturing practices, safety procedures, company rules and regulations.

performs on-line qc and checks in process / finished product specifications on the required frequency to ensure good quality products.

conducts daily inventory of raw, packaging, cleaning materials, consumables, and finished goods depending on machine being operated.

accomplishes and signs production reports (forms and logbooks) and inventory reports.

reports all matters affecting machine operation and product quality to production supervisor.

ensures proper turnover of the machine operation to his reliever.

coordinates with other machine operators.

ensures machines are properly shutdown and all materials (good and rejects) are properly segregated, weighed, labeled and placed in designated areas.

conducts general cleaning of machine and surroundings as per standard cleaning procedures

ensures that all machine parts / accessories and tools are in placed/ secured and machines are turned-off before leaving the area.

performs other functions as may be assigned by superior from time

work schedule: monday - saturday (shifting schedule)

what are the qualifications?

candidate must possess at least a bachelor's/college degree, engineering (mechanical), engineering (industrial), engineering (electrical/electronic), engineering (others), engineering (mechatronic/electromechanical) or equivalent.

applicants must be willing to work at laguna international industrial park (liip), brgy. mamplasan, city of binan, laguna

preferably 1-4 yrs experienced employees specializing in manufacturing/production operations or equivalent.

fresh graduates are welcome to apply.

on-the-job training (ojt) within functional teams

technical and product training across vertiv’s portfolio

project-based learning aligned with real business needs

mentorship and coaching from experienced professionals

performance feedback to support growth and development

business-aligned project

regular progress check-ins and feedback

about us

denso philippines corporation is the subsidiary of denso corporation of japan. it is one of denso’s global companies found in more than 38 countries and regions worldwide. denso is a leading supplier of advanced automotive technology, systems and components for all the world’s major automakers. committed to make the world better by creating superior car parts, denso has innovated many world-first products and technologies. 

through denso’s efforts to expand globally, philippine auto components, inc. (former company name) was established in the philippines, march of 1995. june of 2016 the company was renamed as denso philippines corporation. currently, products manufactured in the company are: meter cluster, air-con, radiator, compressor, smart key, sender gauge and sonar sensor. it also distributes aftermarket products: wiper blades, spark plugs, horn, cdi, relay, ac generator, bus air-con, ac service parts, diesel service parts and accessories such as ionizer and hand scanner.

denso’s mission is “contributing to a better world by creating value together with a vision for the future”.

our goal is to contribute to the society by innovating and creating products that would make driving safer and more secure while preserving the planet. our associates are expected to breakthrough their own boundaries, trust their potential and enhance their capabilities.

must possess at least a vocational diploma / short course certificate, bachelor's/college degree , engineering (mechatronic/electromechanical) or equivalent.
with at least 2 years of experience in machine maintenance/repair (line maintenance and facilities)
knowledgeable on the principles of plc and hydraulic operation
with knowledge and troubleshooting skills on electro-mechanical equipment/machine
willing to work in shifting schedules.
willing to work in lawang bato valenzuela city
can start immediately

- maintain and perform routine preventive maintenance to ensure that machines continue to run smoothly

company description
outsourced.ph is a leading iso certified philippines offshore outsourcing company that provides dedicated remote staff to some of the world's leading international companies. outsourced is recognized as one of the best places to work and has achieved great place to work certification. we are committed to providing a positive and supportive work environment where all staff can thrive. as an outsourced staff member, you will enjoy a fun and friendly working environment, competitive salaries, opportunities for growth and development, work-life balance, and the chance to share your passion with a team of over 1000 talented professionals.

role summary:
we are seeking a highly skilled ai robotics engineer to lead the development of intelligent robotic systems and ai agents that interact with physical environments. the ideal candidate will have strong python programming abilities, proven experience in robotics (both hardware and software), and a deep understanding of ai agent design and deployment, including llms, reinforcement learning, and computer vision.

key responsibilities:


design, develop, and deploy ai agents for robotic systems using python and modern ai frameworks.
integrate sensors, actuators, and robotic middleware (e.g., ros/ros2) with ai pipelines for autonomous decision-making.
collaborate with cross-functional teams (mechanical, electrical, data science) to create smart robotic solutions.
develop and optimize control algorithms, computer vision models, and machine learning pipelines for real-world interaction.
conduct simulations and physical tests of autonomous robotic behavior.
build modular, scalable software for long-term ai system evolution and real-time performance.
document all research, coding practices, system designs, and experiments for technical transparency and replication.
stay up to date with industry trends, academic research, and emerging technologies in ai and robotics.
 required skills & qualifications:

proficiency in python with experience in libraries such as numpy, opencv, pytorch/tensorflow, and asyncio.
3+ years of experience working on robotics projects, including physical systems or simulation (e.g., gazebo, webots).
hands-on experience with ros/ros2, robotic control, path planning, or slam.
strong foundation in ai/ml techniques, including reinforcement learning, nlp, and llm-based agent design.
familiarity with embedded systems and robotic hardware integration.
experience deploying ai agents in real-world or industrial settings.
strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced r&d environment.
 preferred qualifications:

master’s or ph.d. in robotics, computer science, ai, or a related field.
experience with multi-agent systems, simulation environments, or digital twins.
knowledge of cloud computing (aws, gcp) and edge ai deployment.
experience working with robotic arms, drones, amrs, or humanoid systems.
  work schedule:  

monday to friday 7am-4pm
work location: 

homebased; must have strong internet at home; equipment is provided.

mechanical engineering is a broad field focused on designing,analyzing,manufacturing,and maintaining mechanical systems and devices.it involves applying principles of physics, mathematics,and materials science to create solutions for various industries,including automotive,aerospace,and robotics.

job description

a mechanical engineer, designs, builds and tests various mechanical devices, like industrial machines, transportation systems and robotics equipment. their main duties include locating problems with various machinery, conducting experiments to improve different product designs and using cad technology to build product designs.
mechanical engineer duties and responsibilities
a mechanical engineer ensures that all mechanical systems work safely and efficiently to meet user needs. their duties include:
• identifying deficiencies in mechanical processes and developing improvements
• designing and developing prototypes
• analyzing and testing prototypes and each revision of a device
• supervising the development of computer-aided design (cad) project drawings from junior team members
• developing, initiating and managing all phases of projects
• preparing documentation of critical analysis and providing suggestions for correcting errors
• collaborating with project managers for proper allocation and tracking of resources

grow inc might just be that for you! so, who is grow inc? founded in 2016, we’re the australian fintech success story solving big problems in the superannuation and managed funds industry.

the administration platforms (the software that tracks everything to do with your super) are built on things you or your parents would recognise from the glory days of 90’s computing. our vision is to be the trusted, global leader in financial services technology creating simple and secure solutions our customers love. how are we doing it?

we’re solving this by disrupting the wealth management industry with dlta, our platform built on distributed ledger technology which improves the financial wellbeing of australians. we are giving people a brighter, more secure future. we’re making super more timely and information more accessible whilst enabling wealth management companies to offer more cost effective solutions.

we’re rebels with a cause. we’re authentic, diverse, and embrace our differences as we continue to put a dent in the universe. we know diversity of thought helps us to build better solutions for our customers which is why we encourage the entire grow team to bring their whole selves to work each and every day.

job description

the enterprise engineering team is looking for a highly motivated lead systems engineer who will be responsible for the deployment and management of cloud-based and virtual infrastructure. this role requires experience in system administration, scripting, automation, and a background in coordinating with multiple teams.

the successful candidate will be a skilled engineer that knows how to execute and innovate in a modern, dynamic, and high-pressure environment. additionally, the engineer should have experience in mentoring and leading others.

please note this role will be hybrid in dallas, tx or raleigh, nc. visa sponsorship will not be offered at this time.

role responsibilities


perform day to day administration for windows based operating systems and collaboration platforms such as o365/m365.
lead technical projects, as well as perform emergency maintenance on activities requiring special knowledge.
recommend, write, and maintain scripts to increase efficiency and effectiveness of the environment.
work with external vendors and internal team members in providing technical and costs-based information related to new projects.
plan, test and implement solutions in our data center and in the cloud (aws or others).
define optimal architecture and design of new solutions based on requirements.

required skills/experience

windows, active directory, exchange online, adfs/azure, powershell, pki, virtualization technologies - vmware/citrix

desired skills/experience

very strong experience with microsoft clustering services (failover and nlb)
good understanding of core concepts for networking, virtualization and storage.
possess excellent technical problem-solving skills and attention to detail
strongly self-motivated to overcome challenges and identify new opportunities for process improvement
be part of an on-call rotation
highly driven to constantly improve skills and gain new knowledge
excellent written and oral communication with an emphasis on building a stronger team
working experience building infrastructure as code (terraform) is a plus
working experience building os images with packer is a plus
ability to mentor and lead others via strong communication and interpersonal skills
ability to provide direction and coaching
possessing any of the following certification would be a distinctive advantage (mcsa, mcse, vcp, ccna, acsa)

Role of Job: HIRING: Customer Service Representatives | Blended Support
Description:
🔍 what we’re looking for:


✅ college undergraduate in an education-related program
✅ at least 6 months of experience in customer service or technical support (1–2 years preferred)
✅ strong communication and problem-solving skills
✅ ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users clearly and effectively
✅ familiarity with stem tools, apps, or platforms (e.g., scratch, arduino, lego robotics, python) is a plus
✅ experience with helpdesk software (e.g., zendesk, freshdesk) is an advantage
✅ willing to work on-site at occ, ortigas, pasig city

role responsibilities:

respond to customer inquiries via phone, email, chat and social media in a professional and timely manner.

provide step-by-step technical support and troubleshooting for stem-related products (e.g., robotics kits, coding platforms, learning software).

assist with order tracking, product information, returns, account issues, and other general support.

assist customers with installation, configuration, and general product use.

document interactions in crm systems accurately.

collaborate with internal teams (product, engineering, qa) for advanced support or bug resolution.

escalate unresolved issues to the appropriate department while maintaining ownership until resolution.

educate customers on product features and updates to maximize their user experience.

participate in team meetings and training sessions to stay up to date on product knowledge.

at transcosmos, our mission is to leverage customer insights to always be client’s most trusted partner. as an asian-originated company, our vision is to create a global society where everyone is equal and treated with respect. transcosmos® emphasize customer-oriented approach by putting customers as our priority and value their feedback. employee-oriented approach by working as an entity to achieve mutual organizational goals. as professionals, we work with pride, confidence and passion to fulfill responsibilities and accountabilities.

rewarding career

we support and encourage our people to grow in more than one dimension, to achieve all they can be both professionally and personally. as such, we provide our talents with opportunities to embrace changes, promote equal career advancement and growth, thus get rewarded.

connected team

we prioritize mutual understanding, open communication and empowerment to lead things and get everyone connected in the same page. this is manifested through sense of camaraderie, internal alignment, cooperation and collaboration across teams, territories and continents.

intrinsic values and culture

we practice unique values and culture composition where local culture is prioritized and driven to immerse in global culture. it encompasses all aspects inclusive of fostering professional relationship enriched with transparent communication and mutual beliefs on gender equality, demographics, diversity and inclusion.
